definition: to clasp hands/to put one's palms together (in prayer)
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
variant of 合[he2]
palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield
see 佛手瓜[fo2 shou3 gua1]
to clasp hands/to put one's palms together (in obeisance)

sentences.english: My hands can comb my hair and fold in prayer.
sentences.chinese: 我可以用手梳头，可以合掌祈祷。

sentences.english: And I closed and opened my hand again, and behold there was a bird.
sentences.chinese: 我合掌又张开，瞧，它又变作一只鸟。

sentences.english: He sits up on his back legs and puts his front paws together before the altar .
sentences.chinese: 牠会用后腿坐立在祭坛前，前脚合掌拜拜。

sentences.english: With folded hands, O lord of all worlds, shall I stand before thee face to face.
sentences.chinese: 呵，全世界的主，我能合掌和你对面站立吗？

sentences.english: Conan folds his paws in prayer in Naha, Japan, on Jan. 18, 2008.
sentences.chinese: 一月十八日，柯南在日本那霸合掌祈祷。

sentences.english: Hezhang Peak is one of Mt .
sentences.chinese: 合掌峰是雁荡山的代表景观之一。

definition: to put one's palms together (in prayer or greeting)
